alert.note: Alert for Marshall; St. Joseph; Starke (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 11:21AM EST until February 21 at 5:30PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...Ohio... Yellow River at Plymouth affecting Marshall, Starke and St. Joseph IN Counties. Auglaize River near Fort Jennings affecting Allen OH, Paulding and Putnam Counties. ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Ohio... Kankakee River at Davis affecting Starke, La Porte and St. Joseph IN Counties. Ottawa River near Kalida affecting Putnam County. .These river rises will shift ice within the river and could lead to ice jams. This forecast is based on unobstructed flow and does not factor additional rises associated with ice jams. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellow River at Plymouth. * WHEN...From this evening to Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, A small trailer park near the Jefferson Street bridge begins to flood. At 14.5 feet, The parking lot on Laporte Street begins to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM EST Thursday /9:45 AM CST Thursday/ the stage was 10.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage late this evening to 14.5 feet early Saturday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon to 11.2 feet and begin rising again Tuesday morning. It will rise to 11.3 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
